fields.description:
The pull request doesn't need to display the changes for each file when there are too many. 

If it just displayed all the file names, so I could check them out with a git client or through browsing the source code on BitBucket, would be helpful.
fields.summary: For large pull requests, Bitbucket could render the affected file names

fields.description:
Hey guys,
Sometimes you have to review PR and it contains a lot of files so I have to scroll down and down etc.
In order to return to the top y I have to use browser scroll bar. I think it will a good addition to add some "Go to Top" button  in order to improve app interaction
Thanks
fields.summary: Create "Go to Top" button on create/review PR

fields.description:
Bitbucket is providing codeowner feature in server version , same feature is avilable with github and gitlub. My organization is looking for the same feature to use in Monorepo where we have to provide folder level access to users. I will suggest to have code owner plugin in Bitbucket cloud version. 

 

Thanks
fields.summary: code owner feature for repository

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The squash merge commits message has an empty line when commits involved are pushed from the command line. The behaviour is not observed when commits are made on Bitbucket Cloud UI.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Perform multiple commits using the command line
 # Create a Pull Request to merge these commits
 # Use the `Squash merge` strategy
 # The merge commit message will have an empty line between the commit messages

h3. Expected Results

The steps shown above are not observed when commits are created over Bitbucket Cloud UI. The same is expected when commits are pushed from local.
h3. Actual Results

Empty lines are added between commit messages.
h3. Workaround

Manually remove the empty lines in the commit message.
fields.summary: Squash merge commit message has an empty line when pushed from the command line

fields.description: Currently, it is possible to enforce the use of Jira Issue Keys on commit messages only. It would be great to be able to require the Issue key only on Pull Requests.
fields.summary: Ability to require Issue Keys on Pull Requests

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users are unable to load Pipelines/Deployments page intermittently
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log in to Bitbucket (bitbucket.org)
 # Select one of the repositories
 # Click on Pipelines or Deployments page on the left pane
 # You might observe Pipelines or Deployments page doesn't load intermittently

h3. Expected Results

Pipelines and Deployments page should always load
h3. Actual Results

Pipelines and Deployments page doesn't load intermittently
h3. Workaround

Please refresh the page or wait for some time and you should be able to view the page without any issue.
fields.summary: Unable to load Pipelines/Deployments page intermittently

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Build step logs generated from Bitbucket pipelines are sometimes incomplete and at times missing from the UI. However, we can obtain the complete logging by download the build log file. That said, it hampers the users from arriving at the error initially.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Run the pipeline BUILD
 # Step 2 The Build steps hits a failure and generates console logs
 # Step 3: The logs generated by the failures are inconsistent/Missing

h3. Expected Results

The logs on the UI should include all the activity and help locate the point of failure if any.
h3. Actual Results

We see that the logs are missing and not completely available on the UI
h3. Workaround


 Use the API to automate the logs to be downloaded and stored which can the catalogued per step. The {color:#00875a}GET{color} method to obtain the logs using the below [Download Logs using the API |https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pipelines/%7Bpipeline_uuid%7D/steps/%7Bstep_uuid%7D/log]
fields.summary: Occasionally missing Pipelines build logs from the UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using $web string in Azure web storage pipe is not respected, the pipe ignores the $web due to internal script.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a $web URL from Azure web storage
 # use the following pipe [here|https://bitbucket.org/microsoft/azure-storage-deploy/src/master/]
 # Use $web path in the pipe and run the build

h3. Expected Results
The build will fail on the last steps with error missing path because it's missing $web in the path
h3. Actual Results
The build should look and use $web in all of its steps paths.

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
+ echo '+++ azcopy cp '\''build/*'\'' '\''https://test.blob.core.windows.net/$AZURE_STORAGE_SAS_TOKEN'\'' --log-level=DEBUG --recursive
INFO: Scanning...
failed to perform copy command due to error: cannot transfer individual files/folders to the root of a service. Add a container or directory to the destination URL'
+ '[' 1 -eq 0 ']'
+ fail 'Deployment failed.'
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Use Azure cli to copy files
fields.summary: Using $web string in Azure web storage pipe is not respected

fields.description:
To go along with https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BCLOUD-20212 , I'd like to request support for renaming the `master` branch of an existing repository without causing massive disruption. For example:
 * Existing local clones that reference the old branch name should still be able to fetch it and (if possible) push to it, possibly with a warning to the user. There's an [ongoing discussion|https://lore.kernel.org/git/20200803194006.GA2715275@coredump.intra.peff.net/] of features that might be added to the standard git client and server to facilitate branch renames.  BitBucket may be able to use some of those or may need its own implementation depending on technical constraints.
 * Existing pull requests targeting the old branch name should be updated to target the new branch name.
 * Forks of the repository hosted on BitBucket or other things on BitBucket may need to be updated in some way; someone familiar with all the features would have to think this through.

It's possible to manually create a branch of the new name and change the default branch, but that doesn't do any of the things above.

See:
 * [GitHub's brief plan for a "seamless move for existing repositories"|https://github.com/github/renaming#later-this-year-seamless-move-for-existing-repositories-]
 * [Analogous feature request for GitLab|https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/233427]
fields.summary: Support renaming the `master` branch without disruption

fields.description: Workspace and Project views should include an "Issues" tab like repositories, as well as a "Feed" section. The "Issues" will display all issues for the repositories residing within that workspace or project (depending on the view), and the "Feed" can show a timeline of significant events like new tags on each repository. This would give a much better digest of the projects within various hierarchies.
fields.summary: Issue and Feed management tools for projects and workspaces

fields.description: When viewing a workspace, the only columns available are "Repository", "Last updated", and "Builds". It would be nice if there were options to customize the columns similar to how Jira can show various issue properties in additional columns. For instance, it'd be useful to add the ability to insert a "Project" column that display's the repo's project from within the workspace view.
fields.summary: Add Project column to workspace view

fields.description:
*Summary:*
We see that within a shared workspace. Only the Admin of the workspace can view the build minutes on the repository or the Admin of the repository can view this information.

Request to allow users with Read & Write permission to be able be able to view the pipelines usage.

*Note:* There is no workaround for the users with read/write permissions to view the used build minutes apart from check with the Admin user.
fields.summary: Allow users to view Build Minutes Usage

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If the customer changes their default merge strategies from merge commit to squash, it does not change on the Slack integration

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change default merge strategies to Squash merge
 # Connect Bitbucket with Slack integration
 # Create a PR and approve
 # Open Slack and click merge

h3. Expected Results
The merge strategies should follow the default settings in Bitbucket
h3. Actual Results
The merge strategies do not follow the default settings in Bitbucket

h3. Workaround
No workaround available at this moment, user has to manually change their merge strategies.
fields.summary: Changing default merge strategies does not apply to Slack integration

fields.description:
Right now the only way to make it work is adding a bot account to the repository, giving said account permission to push in the branch and manage its SSH keys.



There could be some kind of special user that we can give permissions through the branch permissions.
fields.summary: Can't push back to repository when branch permissions are enabled

fields.description:
Embrace and advocate for atomic commits by introducing a commit per commit review system. 

The current PR experience encourages an entire feature in a single commit, which affects how people write code and also the ability to revert changes later.

Implementing this would promote reviews where thought process and logic is better considered and understood and easier to recognize bugs ahead of time instead of needing to consume and scan through large blocks of code.
fields.summary: Support commit by commit review

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Newly added admins can't see the "APPS AND FEATURES" section of the Workspace that was  converted from a personal user account
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add/invite a new admin to Admins group on the workspace;
 # When the newly added admin goes to workspace -> settings > they cannot see the section for "*APPS AND FEATURES*"

h3. Expected Results

The newly added admin should be able to see the "Apps And Features" section of the workspace settings.
h3. Actual Results

The newly added admin cannot see or use the "Apps And Features" section of the workspace Settings.
h3. Workaround

Create a new workspace, that allows for multiple Admin and is not converted from a personal workspace
fields.summary: Newly added admins can't use "APPS AND FEATURES" tab in converted workspace settings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The "Recent repositories" feature in the dashboard does not work correctly. It shows only the last visited repository when you open the repositories by direct link.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open repository by direct link one by one:
 Example:
 [https://bitbucket.org/mirror/git]
 [https://bitbucket.org/mirror/cassandra]
 [https://bitbucket.org/mirror/apache-directory-server]
 # Go to Bitbucket Dashboard [https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/overview].
 # You will see there is only one repository in the "Recent repositories" block. 

h3. Expected Results

Under the "Recent repositories" section, I expect to see the 3 repositories which I have visited recently.
h3. Actual Results

There is only one repository(the last visited repository) shown under "Recent repositories"
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior, however, in order to keep track of the last changes done to repositories that you have access to, you should be able to check the page:
* https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/repositories
fields.summary: "Recent repositories" feature does not work correctly
Support main branch update via API

fields.description:
The list view of pull requests on the "Your Work" overview page lists all open PRs that I am reviewing.

These are displayed as "[title] ->  [target branch]".

The source branch would also be very interesting. It would speed up the workflow because it helps checking out the branch quickly.
fields.summary: Display source branch for pull requests on overview page

fields.description:
Page "Projects" very unusable. I see a list of projects but I don't see the Workplace where the project is located.

 

Could you add the column "Workplace" to the projects list? Or display project name like "workspace/project".
fields.summary: Display full path of the project on Projects page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Markdown rendering fails if a file contains a Jira issue key
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a markdown file
 # Add JIRA issue key
 # Save markdown file

h3. Expected Results
The markdown file is rendered properly
h3. Actual Results
The markdown file failed to render

h3. Workaround
Remove the JIRA issue key from the markdown file
fields.summary: Markdown rendering fails if a file contains a Jira issue key

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding "include" option on commits api causes all commits from the repository to be returned

https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/commits#get

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run the following API call:
{code}
curl -X GET -u username:AppPass https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/WorkspaceID/Repo_slug/commits/?include=Branch1&exclude=Branch2
{code}

h3. Expected Results
The API would fetch all commits from Branch1 that are not in Branch2

h3. Actual Results
All commits on the repository are fetched

h3. Workaround

You are use the same API call excluding the "include" option to select a single branch to be returned such as:
{code}
curl -X GET -u username:AppPass https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/WorkspaceID/Repo_slug/commits/?Branch1&exclude=Branch2
{code}
fields.summary: Adding "include" option on commits api causes all commits from the repository to be returned

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a workspace name is updated, any new or existing Jira DVCS connectors for that workspace do not get updated with the new name. Users do do not have the ability to force the update to reflect the correct Workspace name in DVCS
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect a Jira Cloud account to a Bitbucket Workspace
 # Change the name of the Bitbucket workspace
 # Go back to DVCS page in Jira, observe the name is not updated with the new name

h3. Expected Results

The name in DVCS should be updated to reflect the _new_ Workspace name
h3. Actual Results

The DVCS page in Jira shows the _original_ workspace name.
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When workspace name is updated in Bitbucket, and new or existing Jira DVCS connectors do not get updated with the new name
Ability to sort pull requests by its date of creation

fields.description:
Right now, when going to connect to a Jira Cloud account, it is only able to "find" accounts based off the login email the user is logged into Bitbucket with.

 

Sometimes, a user may use their personal email as a login email for bitbucket, but may use a a _company_ email to access their company's Jira instance. That user is then not able to connect any work-related Bitbucket repo's to their Jira projects since they use their personal email to login to bitbucket.

 

It would be nice if there was another way to link accounts other than by going by email. Perhaps if it could find Jira accounts based off the users' email aliases, then the user could just add their Jira login email as an email alias in bitbucket.
fields.summary: Improvement around connecting Jira Cloud with Bitbucket

fields.description:
In order for Bitbucket Cloud to be 21 CFR Part 11 compliance, we should have the option for Pull Requests to be digitally signed when approved. 

The approvers must sign with their username and password. Also possible to require N digital signatures before a PR can be merged.
fields.summary: Allow digitally signed approvals on Pull Requests

fields.description: Currently, we do not support Japanese CP932 encoding in the Bitbucket UI diff.
fields.summary: Support for Japanese CP932 encoding in diff UI

fields.description:
Whenever a code diff is quite big, Bitbucket adds a horizontal scroll bar to allow the reviewer to view the rest of the code.

When this happens, and you want to add a comment, the comment modal can get cut off, as it will not scroll with the rest of the diff, like this:
 !Screen Shot 2020-07-27 at 10.43.48.png|thumbnail! 

The request here is to make sure that the PR comment modal scrolls together with the line of diff being reviewed so that it's easier to write the comment while reviewing the code at the same time.
fields.summary: Scroll PR comment modal together with the code diff

fields.description:
Please, add a possibility to create a Pull Request to more than branchs.

Example:

i opened a hotfix from master, i create a Pull Request to master and release and develop one to one, a possibility to create in same Pull Request to this 3 branchs is helpfull
fields.summary: Bulk Pull Request
Pass Pipeline Variables to schedule jobs

fields.description: When creating an issue with the issue tracker the text box is not taking full advantage of the browser's width. The text box should responsively extend to cover the with of the browser or allow users to expand the text box to avoid wasting real estate
fields.summary: Issue tracker text box is should extend further

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When navigating to a PR on the new PR experience on a mobile device, the button to open the sidebar is missing from the navigation pane.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Shrink your viewport width to < 980px to trigger the mobile header;
 # Navigate to any PR, while the new PR experience is enabled;
 # The sidebar icon is not present.

h3. Expected Results
The Sidebar icon shows up in the user interface.

h3. Actual Results
The sidebar icon doesn't show up when opening a PR on the new PR experience.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior on the new pull request experience. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Sidebar trigger button on PRs is missing from the mobile header

fields.description:
I am providing random example of Bitbucket pipeline config that I tried to set up and was failing on the fact that firebase-deploy pipeline uses higher version of node and we can't influence it.

My suggestion would be that if a node version is defined for particular step where pipe is used, the pipe should also switch to this node version.

!https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/102821i4EEC3E6085B3E59B/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999!

 

Otherwise we get this error...

!https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/102820iA7E3C4D14A8707B3/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999!
fields.summary: Node version when using bitbucket pipeline pipes

fields.description:
On the left-hand sidebar, it *Pipelinesnull* instead of pipelines

[Drive Link | https://drive.google.com/file/d/1aCfvLit_w98UJRkYGAe9aQyotTxCwssG/view?usp=sharing]
fields.summary: Pipelines grammar mistake

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we run the Tags API under repositories, if there is no tagger (user who created the tag) on the tags, it results in an error. 
 API in question : [https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/refs/tags#get]
{code:java}
/2.0/repositories/{workspace}/{repo_slug}/refs/tags
{code}
If there is no tagger , this is how we get an error while navigating from page to page (considering there is more than one page of tags with pagelen =100
{code:java}
"message": "Something went wrong",
"id": "57c71c932acd47e7949995e9b9352c2b"
{code}

{code:java}
AttributeError /2.0/repositories/xxxxxx/git/refs/tags
error
'NoneType' object has no attribute 'time'
{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Unable to replicate this situation as we cannot create tags without a tagger. The git canonical repository (https://github.com/git/git repository) has a similar problem in the v0.99 tag which can be used for testing.

h3. Expected Results

Having no Tagger should not break the API.
h3. Actual Results

No tagger in these tags breaks the Tag API with 500 error.
h3. Workaround

The user can delete and create the tag again.
fields.summary: Bitbucket Cloud Returns Error if the tags has no tagger field

fields.description:
{panel:title=Implementation of New Features Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
 You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

The [Labs|https://bitbucket.org/account/admin/features/] option *Delete dangling commits when over size limit* should also run when the repository size is between *2-4 GB* but not only *4-10 GB* because otherwise the user cannot suppress the warnings on UI.

h3. Suggested Solution

Implementing BCLOUD-11593 would be ideal. Until then, please includes the soft limit to the auto git-gc.

h3. Workaround

As the [soft limit|https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/what-kind-of-limits-do-you-have-on-repositoryfile-size/] is only about notice and there's no actual restriction, you can ignore the message and notification. If you still want to suppress the warning, the repository admin needs to contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/].
fields.summary: The auto git-gc option should also run for the soft limit warnings at 2-4 GB

fields.description: The current login page of bitbucket.org shows username field first and then password field upon clicking on continue. The request is to have a classic login form that shows username and password fields at the same time on the login page.
fields.summary: Classic login form to show username and password at the same time

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you have a Jira instance connected to your Workspace account and in your Pull request you want to merge it, the Jira statuses are unreadable.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Integrate your Jira instance to your Workspace account
# Add a long status in your Jira instance
# Create a new Jira issue
# Create a new commit and pull request with the new Jira issue key
# Try to merge it and change the Jira status name

 !pr_Jira_status.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Long Jira status will be readable and/or there's a tooltip when you hover the status

h3. Actual Results
There's no way to read the entire Jira status on the merge PR screen

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: While merging a PR, there's no way to read a long Jira issue status

fields.description:
I used the bfg-repo-cleaner tool on the repository, followed this usage instruction [https://rtyley.github.io/bfg-repo-cleaner/]

after this command {{git reflog expire --expire=now --all && git gc --prune=now --aggressive }}

I used git push and my remote git server is updated with former commit id, meaning the push was successfully done. But the size increased which was supposed to reduce my repo size.

from 1 GB to 1.25 GB
fields.summary: Bfg-repo-cleaner tool successful but repo size not decreased

fields.description:
*Summary:*
The conditional step allows users to use Exclude instead of just include. Exclude allows users to remove the files which are not required from the Build container. 

*Workarounds:*
- Use LFS and .gitignore
- Delete files from the Build container using
- EXTRA_ARGS: '–exclude"
- Use sub-keyword: "includePath"

*(i) Note:* But not all scenarios or use cases can be covered with the listed workaround.
fields.summary: Provision for Exclude option within Conditional Steps in Pipelines

fields.description:
Request Summary:
The request is to have an API to be able to GET and DELETE users who have standalone access to the repositories.

The current invitation API allows you to add users, but need expanding to include editing user permission (direct) and deleting users with direct permission for the purpose of Automation via API. 

Workaround:
Need to have them removed by the Admin from the Bitbucket UI
fields.summary: Ability to DELETE users on repository using API

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when Bitbucket sends a notification e-mail, the name of the author/ modifier is included in the "From" field.

h3. Suggested Solution
Remove this field, leaving just the instance's name.
fields.summary: Remove names from the "from" field on e-mail notifications

fields.description:
In Bitbucket, we have the repository search on the right-hand side navigation bar.
 When searching for a repository, it lists repositories that partially match the keyword but does not display the repository that matches the exact keyword.

*Example*: Searching for "platform": does not return the repository which is called exactly "platform". It does return other repositories like "platform-backend", "platform-frontend", "new-platform", etc.
fields.summary: Improve the repository search feature by accuracy and sorting

fields.description:
{panel:title= Bug Fix Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}

At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
 You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

If you change the workspace's ID, the project creation form leads you to the 404-page even the project is successfully created.


 !Screen Shot 2020-07-17 at 17.12.00.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the workspace-id
 # Create a project under the workspace
 # Check the redirected page shows "That link has no power here"
 # Check the project creation is succeeded per se

h3. Expected Results

The redirection works properly.
h3. Actual Results

The redirection needs to redirect the user to:
 * something like [https://bitbucket.org/WORKSPACE_ID/workspace/projects/SAP]
 * but not [https://bitbucket.org/account/user/WORKSPACE_ID/projects/SAP]

h3. Workaround

Find the correct link at the workspace page.
fields.summary: Incorrect redirection after the project creation with workspace-id change

fields.description: According to [https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/test-reporting-in-pipelines/|https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/test-reporting-in-pipelines/], Bitbucket test reporting works with most XML [xUnit-compatible test reports|http://reflex.gforge.inria.fr/xunit.html#xunitReport]. I would like to see support for [Allure|http://allure.qatools.ru/] test reports as well. Since Allure is open source and completely dedicated to test reporting, I think this would be a good fit.
fields.summary: Support For Allure Test Results

fields.description: It would be nice to have a Docker image suggested to us when pipeline steps take a lot of time adding dependencies.
fields.summary: Suggest Dockerfiles when builds take too long.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Accessing a PR which had its source and destination branch deleted throws an error (Something went wrong)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two branches (A, B)
 # Add a file to any and merge them 
 # Delete the branches
 # Run a GC on Bitbucket side

h3. Expected Results
You would be able to see what was merged at that point in time and which commits had on this PR.

h3. Actual Results
You get an error message.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Accessing a PR which had its source and destination branch deleted throws an error (Something went wrong)

fields.description:
*Summary:*
As of Today Bitbucket Pipelines doesn't support role based authentication for Amazon ECR. We just have the option for AWS key based authentication.

Request is to accommodate role based authentication with Bitbucket Pipelines along with AWS deployments.
fields.summary: Role based Authentication for Amazon ECR

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a workspace admin, which is not the owner of that workspace, creates a snippet he can't see that snippet afterward.

*Please note:* This behavior is only reproducible in personal workspaces, not on team workspaces.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a personal workspace where you are an admin;
 # Create a snippet;
 # Try to view that snippet;
 # You'll be presented with the "Create a snippet" screen.

h3. Expected Results

Admins should be able to see the workspace's snippets;
h3. Actual Results

The admin is presented with the "Create a snippet screen"
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Workspace admins can't see snippets after creating them

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Readme markdown code inserts half-space at the start of the code as below:
 !Screenshot 2020-07-15 at 1.10.28 PM.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create code markdown
 # Add the following example
 {code}
```
$ cd .../trial
[.../trial]$
```
{code}

h3. Expected Results
There's no half-space at the start of the code

h3. Actual Results
There's a half-space at the start of the code

h3. Workaround
None at this moment
fields.summary: Creating a code markdown in readme has a half-space at the start of the code

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The commits graph is not displayed when you go directly to a page URL like [https://bitbucket.org/testwrkspacae/testrepo/commits/?page=5|https://bitbucket.org/oaet/oaesource/commits/?page=2]
or when you refresh on any page.

The graph is displayed only when you click 'previous'/'next' on the first page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the commits page of a repository.
 # You can navigate to the previous commits by clicking on the "next" button. This will take you to the next page. 
 # However, the commits graph is not displayed when you go directly to a page URL, for example, [https://bitbucket.org/testwrkspacae/testrepo/commits/?page=5|https://bitbucket.org/oaet/oaesource/commits/?page=2], or when you refresh on any page.

h3. Expected Results

The commit-graph should load when you directly go to a commits page URL.
h3. Actual Results

The commits graph is not displayed when you directly to a page URL or refresh the page.
h3. Workaround

Navigate to a particular page by clicking "next" starting from 1st page until you reach the required page.
fields.summary: The commits graph is not displayed when you navigate directly to a commits page.

fields.description:
Currently, Webhooks' triggers for a repository are limited and we don't have a trigger for the Workspace level.

It would be best if we can also expand the Webhooks triggers on the Workspace level and add more triggers on the repository level.

*Triggers:*
{panel}
1. User added to a user group
 2. User removed from a user group
 3. User received permission to repository
 4. User permission removed from repository
 5. A new user group was created
 6. A user group was deleted
 7. User was added to workspace i manage
 8. User group base repository permission was changed
 9. User group repository access was changed
{panel}
fields.summary: Add more Webhooks triggers for Repository and Workspace level

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Clicking on the page numbers in the "Git LFS" tab, opens a new AJAX tab

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a repository which contains LFS files
 # Click on one of the page numbers (2 or 3...)

h3. Expected Results
# It opens the second/third page, without creating a new AJAX tab

h3. Actual Results
# It opens new AJAX tab, within the opened tab:
!image-2020-07-14-08-36-58-300.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Clicking on the page numbers in the "Git LFS" tab, open a new AJAX tab

fields.description:
With the recent Workspace changes, repository and content moved under Workspace, the OAuth configuration has moved under the Workspace settings to provide Workspace's admin with more control over how the OAuth can be used to access their Workspace's repositories.

However, this limit users ability to integrate their account with applications such as [Composer|https://getcomposer.org/] which uses OAuth to clone repositories.
* User would need to reach out to Workspace Admin to get the OAuth credential
* Workspace admin would need to generate multiple OAuth consumer for their users if the organization has numerous workspaces.
* Workspace admin unable to control the OAuth access to specific repositories by users or User Groups.

Hence, having the ability to create an OAuth consumer on the account level will provide users with the flexibility to integrate with the 3rd-party application.

h4. Workaround
# Use [AppPassword - Bitbucket Documentation| https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/app-passwords/]
# Use [SSH protocol - Bitbucket Documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/set-up-an-ssh-key/]
{code}
ssh://git@bitbucket.org/<Repo-Owner>/<Repo-name>.git
{code}
(i) You would need to ensure that your machine had the SSH key is loaded to the ssh-agent before performing above.
# *For Composer*: Switch from "bitbuket-oauth" to "http-basic" authentication method with the following config:
{code:java}
{"bitbucket.org": {"username": "<username>", "password": "<AppPassword>"}}
{code}
https://getcomposer.org/doc/06-config.md#http-basic
(i) Please do note that you would need to change the repository type to "vcs"
fields.summary: Ability to create OAuth consumer on the account level

fields.description: The idea of exclude files from diff is nice but for files like .project in ECLIPSE, being able to have two projects, once from each fork, requires different content in the respective .project files (specifically the names). This can happen with other IDEs also. I think it would be useful to have an exclude capability for pull requests between main and fork/fork and main. This shuold supplement the existing exclude from diff capability. To implement this, use a --no-commit on the merge, reset --cached on the excluded file, then commit the change.
fields.summary: Extend exclude files into Pull Requests

fields.description:
already logged in,

using bitbucket's first page shows nothing useful but it does have a link to see your repositories.

why not allow us to go straight to the view of all my repositories?

thanks
fields.summary: already logged in, using bitbucket's first page is useless, why not go straight to the view of all my repositories?

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you use the API endpoint /2.0/repositories with the sort parameter, the *next* parameter data is giving a duplicated repository names. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Run the CURL command below:
{code:java}
curl -u username:app_password "https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories?role=admin&sort=full_name&fields=values.uuid,values.full_name,values.is_private,pagelen,page,next,size,previous"
{code}

Once done, copy the *next* parameter and run it on a CURL command as well.
{code:java}
curl -u username:app_password "https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories?sort=full_name&fields=values.uuid%2Cvalues.full_name%2Cvalues.is_private%2Cpagelen%2Cpage%2Cnext%2Csize%2Cprevious&after=2013-10-21T04%3A45%3A19.503460%2B00%3A00&role=admin"
{code}
You'll notice on the result that some repository names are mentioned again from the first CURL command data result.


h3. Expected Results
There will be no duplicated data

h3. Actual Results
There are duplicated data

h3. Workaround
As workaround, we can remove the sort parameter and the data will be accurate again.
fields.summary: Sorting on the API endpoint /2.0/repositories makes the next parameter data inaccurate

fields.description:
Currently, app passwords are generated automatically and it is very difficult for users to remember the randomly generated password.

It would be great if users can set their own app passwords so that they can remember it easily.
fields.summary: Allow users to set their own app passwords

fields.description:
Customers experienced slowdowns and intermittent failures with Bitbucket Cloud. 
Some customer got 5xx error responses from Bitbucket APIs.

* Impact Start Date/Time: 06/Jul/20 2:00 PM
* Impact End Date/Time: 08/Jul/20 1:55 AM
fields.summary: Customers experienced slowdowns and intermittent failures

fields.description:
I bought a YubiKey for U2F ([https://www.yubico.com/product/security-key-by-yubico])

I followed the below tutorial to generate a SSH Key that supports a U2F key:

[https://cryptsus.com/blog/how-to-configure-openssh-with-yubikey-security-keys-u2f-otp-authentication-ed25519-sk-ecdsa-sk-on-ubuntu-18.04.html]

Unfortunately, when I tried to add the public SSH Key to my Bitbucket account, I get a "That SSH key is invalid." message.

I know the website supports U2F as a second factor for login. Are there plans to support U2F SSH keys?
fields.summary: Support for YubiKey U2F over SSH (ecdsa-sk)

fields.description:
As a user of Bitbucket, I would like the ability to rearrange the tasks defined for a PR, preferably via a drag and drop method. 

 

Currently, there is no way to rearrange the order.
fields.summary: Ability to drag and drop the order of tasks defined in pull requests

fields.description: Working concurrently on several projects, I would find it useful to have the project icon displayed next to the pull requests listed on the "Your work" overview. Especially when I'm working on different projects with the _same_ colleagues, I can't see right away which pull request belongs to which project.
fields.summary: Project icon in "Your work" overview

fields.description:
Based on what I have read on the forum, each step of a Bitbucket Pipeline runs in a separate container. Also, there is currently no easy way to share environment variables between steps.

Here is an idea that would provide this without much work, assuming I'm not too wrong about how you implement pipelines: the basic idea is to automate the following approach that I currently use: 

At the end of each *{{step}}*, I have some lines like this, that save variables into an artifact "shared_vars.sh", such that this artifact can be sourced in subsequent step: 

 
{code:java}
# share variables with subsequent step(s):
- echo export IMAGE_TAG=$IMAGE_TAG > shared_vars.sh
- echo export IMAGE_NAME=$IMAGE_NAME >> shared_vars.sh
{code}
Then in subsequent steps I just need one line at the top of the {{*script*}} element, like this:

 

 
{code:java}
# get vars from previous step:
- source shared_vars.sh
{code}
 

This seems very "automatable":
 * have a section above {{*pipelines*}} where you can define variable names, eg 

{code:java}
image: ...

sharedVars:
- IMAGE_NAME
- IMAGE_TAG

pipelines:
...{code}
 * Bitbucket pipelines engine automatically appends instructions at the _end_ of the list of lines under *{{script}}*, to append code to export the value of each var appearing in *{{sharedVars}}*, just like I did; the file could a temporary "hidden" artifact, but it could just be a file that gets docker copy'd out of the container and into the next. 
 * Bitbucket pipelines engine automatically prepends one line at the _start_ of the list of lines under *{{script}}*, to source that "hidden" env-var-sharing artifact, just like I did.

And voila! You have a feature that everyone has been asking for, for almost no work!
fields.summary: Propsal for sharing data between steps

fields.description:
Based on what I have read on the forum, each step of a Bitbucket Pipeline runs in a separate container. Also, there is currently no easy way to share environment variables between steps.

Here is an idea that would provide this without much work, assuming I'm not too wrong about how you implement pipelines: the basic idea is to automate the following approach that I currently use: 

At the end of each *{{step}}*, I have some lines like this, that save variables into an artifact "shared_vars.sh", such that this artifact can be sourced in subsequent step: 

 
{code:java}
# share variables with subsequent step(s):
- echo export IMAGE_TAG=$IMAGE_TAG > shared_vars.sh
- echo export IMAGE_NAME=$IMAGE_NAME >> shared_vars.sh
{code}
Then in subsequent steps I just need one line at the top of the {{*script*}} element, like this:

 

 
{code:java}
# get vars from previous step:
- source shared_vars.sh
{code}
 

This seems very "automatable":
 * have a section above {{*pipelines*}} where you can define variable names, eg 
 * 
{code:java}
sharedVars:
 - IMAGE_TAG
 - IMAGE_NAME{code}

 * 
 * 
 * The bitbucket pipelines, when it creates the script from the list of lines under `script`, and copies it into the container (I'm guessing that's how it does it), it appends code to export the value of each var appearing in sharedVars, just like I did; the file would a temporary "hidden" artifact.
 * Before each step, Pipelines inserts a line before the first line under script, to source that env-var-sharing artifact, and voila!

I'll see if I can submit a feature request for this.
fields.summary: Proposal for how to share data between steps

fields.description:
Hi I would like to know if you will be developing the option to copy a project from the create project page instead of using the selected project and having to separate it after. I don't want the projects to share information so why not let us create a new project and copy what is in another project without sharing the screens etc…
From the create page project lets enter the project name the key and copy the project selected from the list and then the next page add the issue types and create the screen scheme … so much back and forth right now and takes a lot of time.
Thanks
Denise
fields.summary: Develop more options on the Create Project page

fields.description:
When reviewing a PR with many files, where each file has a large number of comments, it is hard to keep track of all the comments that you have read and implemented

A scroll bar or pagination facility would help to quickly go to a particular comment.

It would be really helpful if the comment messages can be read or processed like messages in a mailbox. Put in bold when new and not read yet. 

Also helpful will be a little checkbox in front of the comment that we can tick to keep track of the comments that are implemented.

For an overview, it would be nice to have a select box to select an option like 'hide' or 'view' all 'ticked' or 'unticked' comments.
fields.summary: Easily scroll/navigate and keep track of comments on a pull request.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Not able to see diffs/commits in a PR, where the source branch is originating from a fork repo owned by a different user.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # user A: Create a repository
 # user A: Create a branch + commit on the newly created repository
 # user B: Fork the newly created repository
 # user B: Create a commit in the fork repo
 # user B: Create a PR from fork repository to parent repository 
 # user A: Review the PR created by user B

h3. Expected Results
Being able to review the diffs/commits 
h3. Actual Results

Error message mentioning:
"Nothing to merge
The source or destination branch was deleted, or these changes already exist in the destination repository"

h3. Workaround

* Add the user A to the forked Repository
or
* Disable the "New Pull Request Experience" in Bitbucket Settings -> Labs (https://bitbucket.org/account/settings/features)
fields.summary: Not able to see diffs/commits in a PR, where the source branch is originating from a fork repo owned by a different user.

fields.description:
*Summary:*
*  Allow an org/team admin to block the users under their organization from creating private repositories in their personal workspaces.
*  With this feature, the admins can administer the users under their organization and have them adhere to work only on shared workspaces.
*  Option to restrict users to fork/import a repository from the Organization workspace to their personal workspace.
fields.summary: Ability for an org/team admin to block users from creating/importing/forking private repositories in their personal workspace

fields.description:
Currently, modifying the title of a pull request is required to modify the state of the associated ticket ([https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/reference-issues-in-your-development-work/):]

"If you create a pull request that has "TIS-3" in the title, the TIS-3 issue will automatically transition from 'In Progress' to 'In Review'. If you reopen, decline, or merge the pull request, it will also transition the TIS-3 issue accordingly."

It would be nice if I could mention a JIRA issue in the _description_ of my PR, to have it transition to In Review over at JIRA. For example, just close with “Fixes PROJ-213” in the GitHub PR description. Rather not dirty up the PR title.
fields.summary: Allow pull request description to alter associated Jira issue status

fields.description:
The reviewers' icon is missing in the new Pull request experience.
In the old pull request experience, the reviewers' icons showed up when a reviewer puts a comment.
The number of pending comments was also shown in the icon. Clicking on the icon took you to the new comment and location in the file. 

!image-2020-07-08-16-58-37-565.png|width=558,height=107!

This feature request is to include this feature in the new pull request experience.
fields.summary: Include the "reviewers' icon with number of comments" in the new pull request experience.
Slack tags reviewer when a PR is approved, better to tag the person who created the PR

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Changing a username's first character from uppercase to lowercase (or vise-versa) is not possible.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click Avatar (on the left)
# Click *Personal settings*
# Change your current username e.g. from *Johndoe* to *johndoe*

h3. Expected Results
Renaming username should be possible

h3. Actual Results
Receiving the error message "An account with that name already exists."

h3. Workaround

# Rename username to something else first (e.g. Johndoe-123)
# Once done, rename it again from Johndoe-123 to johndoe
fields.summary: Renaming username first character
Bitbucket Download API to obtain the complete files with Metadata

fields.description:
I would be nice that cache pipelines had a way to determine an integrity field.

With this field pipeline could determine if a `cache` is different or not to the previously stored in this way:

1. When the pipeline starts it lookup for the defined `cache` and if it exists, pipeline extracts it and uses.
2. On Pipeline teardown, Pipeline computes the integrity for the cache according to the files in the container.
3. If the integrity value is equal to the value of the integrity of the cache extracted in step 1, it doesn't update the cache; but,
4. If the integrity value is different, the cache is compressed, stored, and updated; and also the integrity value for this cache is updated. 

For example, for node cache, pipeline could compute hash of `yarn.lock` or `package-lock.json` file on Pipeline Teardown and if this hash is different to previous integrity value, pipeline could replace that cache.

What do you think about this?
fields.summary: Cache integrity for pipelines cache

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When users navigate between pull requests reports from the previous one are shown in the new one.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Pull request that uses Code insight report
# Navigate from the success code insight pull request report to fail to pull request code insight report
# The success will show as successful in the failed pull request until the user hit refresh button in the browser

h3. Expected Results
It should not follow the previous page cache and show code insight as success in the failure reports.

h3. Actual Results
The failed report showed a success report until the user hit refresh on the web browser.

h3. Workaround
Refresh the page every time user changes to the new Pull request code insight report.
fields.summary: Navigating between pull requests reports from previous one are shown in the new one.

fields.description:
Pipelines should throw a more useful error message if an auth token that is provided as an environment variable does not have sufficient permissions.

An example would be something like "Insufficient auth token permissions, please update your auth token permissions".

These errors should be thrown when a user tries to export a dataset from pipelines.

At the moment it seems that the error messages are somewhat unclear.
fields.summary: Better error handling for auth token permissions in Pipelines

fields.description: This is only a mild annoyance, but would be a nice quality of life improvement. Whenever I create a new PR the page which loads wants to default to the master branch, which typically is many many commits behind the working branch. When the page loads it pauses briefly at the top, almost asking you to click on the dropdown to select the branch you want to merge into, but by the time I move my mouse over to make a selection, the page jumps down to somewhere halfway down the page. Can you do anything to make the top section of the page possibly be "sticky" near the top, or improve the way the javascript loads on this one page?
fields.summary: New Pull Request page load "jumping" before I can select a branch to merge into

fields.description:
Currently, there's no API 2.0 endpoint that shows distinguished permissions data between the group and direct user access to a repository.

It would be very useful if we could provide this data in an API 2.0 endpoint.
fields.summary: API 2.0 endpoint for distinguished permissions between group and direct user access to a repository

fields.description: It would be useful to be able to hide the Transition Issues section when merging pull requests for a given repository. Eg: if the associated project already has a workflow automation set up.
fields.summary: Option to Hide Transition Issues section on Merge

fields.description:
Please consider supporting encryption at rest for source code stored in Bitbucket Cloud.

[GitHub made the change to convert their hosts to encrypted disks in May 23, 2019|https://github.blog/changelog/2019-05-23-git-data-encryption-at-rest/], so they've proven it possible for a code management product to support encryption at scale without detrimental performance and data recovery impacts.
fields.summary: Support encryption at rest for source code

fields.description:
Currently, if you install the *SonarCloud* app from the workspace marketplace and you didn't configure it, you'll receive the notification below on your pull request page.
 !app_notification_on_pr.png|thumbnail! 

The notification states that it should be actioned by going to the workspace's settings.

Unfortunately, the notification shows on any PR regardless of the permission a user has on a workspace or repository.

Now, for users who have read/write permission, they won't be able to make the changes.

It would be best if we could only show the notification for admin users not for users with read or write access permission.
fields.summary: SonarCloud notification on pull request
Deployment detail returned for Pipeline Steps

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On a comment box, starting a list on a number other than 1 does not work. The list will start at 1.

On our support documentation [Markup comments|https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/markup-comments/], states that the {{sane_lists}} extension for Python-Markdown is supported.

Sane list allows for recognizes numbers and can start with a number other than 1
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a comment box
 # add a numbered list that with a number other than 1

h3. Expected Results

The list should start on a number other than 1

4. Item A
5. Item B
6. Item C
7. Item D

h3. Actual Results
The list does not start on the desired number. The list starts at 1.

1. Item A
2. Item B
3. Item C
4. Item D

!list.gif|width=513,height=177!

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Starting a list on a number other than 1 does not work

fields.description: At this time, Bitbucket supports attachments to PRs without a file size limit, but don't have support for displaying gifs (yet).
fields.summary: Support GIFs in PR comments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Hello Team,

We have identified a bug that causes PR diffs to NOT display when certain conflicts are present. In this case the conflicts are related to renaming.

The sentry error received is "MergeUnhandledConflictError".

Kindly check into this.

Regards
Manu A

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Merge conflicts related to renaming
{code}
CONFLICT (rename/rename): Rename XXXX->YYYY in HEAD. Rename ZZZZZ->YYYY in 
BRANCH
Auto-merging YYYY
{code}
 # Refusing to lose dirty file at YYYY
Auto-merging YYYY
Automatic merge failed; fix conflicts and then commit the result.

h3. Expected Results

If possible, have a more detailed output of the error.

h3. Actual Results

500 Error with Sentry error : "MergeUnhandledConflictError"

h3. Workaround

Resolve the conflicts locally instead of using the Bitbucket UI in this situation.
fields.summary: Unable to show PR diff when there are certain conflicts in a Pull Request

fields.description:
Hello Team, 

We have identified a bug that causes PR diffs to NOT display when certain conflicts are present. In this case the conflicts are related to renaming. 

The sentry error received is "MergeUnhandledConflictError".

Kindly check into this. 

Regards
Manu A
fields.summary: Unable to show PR diff when there are certain conflicts in a Pull Request

fields.description:
Currently, Webhook is triggered when a branch is deleted from the repository.

However, there are various use cases where users don't want to trigger Webhook at the time of the branch deletion and there is no option to disable this trigger.

An option should be added in Webhook list of triggers to enable or disable webhook on branch deletion.
fields.summary: Option to enable or disable Webhook trigger on branch deletion

fields.description:
Currently, it is only possible to navigate to the next or previous page, as there is no option to pick a specific page on the commits tab.

We would like to be able to navigate between pages like other web applications allow us.

Actual behavior:

 !image-2020-07-01-15-49-34-782.png|thumbnail! 

Expected behavior after the implementation of this new feature:

 !image-2020-07-01-15-52-26-121.png|thumbnail! 

Workaround:

Currently it is possible to change the URL from:
eg. 
https://bitbucket.org/marcolino66966/repository/commits/?page=2

to 

https://bitbucket.org/marcolino66966/repository/commits/?page={color:red}10{color}

in order to jump from the page 2 to the page 10, however, this is not the optimal for us.
fields.summary: Add the pagination option to the commits page

fields.description:
While adding review comments to Java files, Select Language dialogue should get its default value from the current file extension.

!image-2020-07-01-20-11-40-674.png!
fields.summary: Select language dropdown should get prepopulated based on file extension

fields.description:
When I merge between two branches without a pull request, that merge does not appear in the repository commits. 

Follow the example below running local:

- git fetch && git checkout master
- git pull
- git merge develop
- git push
fields.summary: Add merge commit to the repository commits

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using pullrequest update API endpoint, to add a reviewers to the existing Pull request, if you include UUID of a user that is set to inactive, our API responds with 

"message": "reviewers: Malformed reviewers list"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Pull request on Bitbucket
 # Make sure the user who you would like to add has access to this repository
 # Deactivate user's account via Active Directory (for managed account)
 # Use the inactive user UUID to update the PR and try to add him as a reviewer

[https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pullrequests/%7Bpull_request_id%7D#put]

   5. Bitbucket will respond with not a very user friendly message that might lead to thinking that the syntax for JSON was wrong
h3. Expected Results

To respond to the user indicating: "User you are trying to add as a reviewer is inactive, thus this action cannot be completed"
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
{"type": "error","error": {"fields": {"reviewers": [  "Malformed reviewers list"],},"message": "reviewers: Malformed reviewers list"}
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

The workaround for the user is to go Bitbucket UI and check if the user he is trying to add as a reviewer is Active or not. This can also be checking by making a call to the user UUID endpoint and see if the user status is Active or Not.

Then remove that user's UUID from the PUT request body to complete the PR update successfully.
fields.summary: Improve error message for API response when adding inactive user as a PR reviewer

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* API endpoint to list out the steps for the specific pipeline build does not show the next page for more than 10 steps.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a build with more than 10 steps
# Run the following API request /2.0/repositories/<workspace>/<repo_slug>/pipelines/<pipeline_uuid>/steps/
# It will only show 10 steps and there's no next pagination URL

h3. Expected Results
It should give information about the existing next page, for example:
{code}
  "size": 5421,
  "page": 2,
  "pagelen: 10,
  "next": "https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/pypy/pypy/commits?page=3",
  "previous": "https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/pypy/pypy/commits?page=1",
  "values": [
    ...
  ]
{code}

h3. Actual Results
It's not showing any next page or total page at the end of the API request.

h3. Workaround
* Manually add a page at the back of the API request, for example:
/2.0/repositories/<workspace>/<repo_slug>/pipelines/<pipeline_uuid>/steps/?page=1
fields.summary: API request for list of steps in pipeline build does not show next page URL

fields.description:
It would be useful for us to have an option to either:
# Set a default transition state in the Transition issues section on Merge. 
#* This would help an admin decide what the transition state is supposed to be when there is multiple options present. 
# Set the Transition issues section off
#* Since the default value isn't necessarily what the admin expects/requires, having the wrong/unexpected option on this feature can/will cause workflow issues in Jira
fields.summary: Option to Set Default Status on Transition Issues section on Merge

fields.description: It would be a great feature if we can have a way to archive projects on Bitbucket Cloud.
fields.summary: Ability to archive projects

fields.description:
*User stories:* 

 * As an admin, I want to be able to pinpoint a problem related to one of my secure environment variables
 * As an admin, I want to have insight into the secured values I have set so I have one central place to manage these values

*Scope*

This is related to both "Repository Variables" and "Deployment Variables".

 

*Suggestion UI*

Use the [Atlassian Icons|https://docs.atlassian.com/aui/7.9.3/docs/icons.html] of "watch-filled" and "new-watch" to create a toggle mechanism.
fields.summary: As an admin, I want to see the value of my secured environment variables

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Code blocks in default PR descriptions show up as "Unsupported Content" in PR descriptions.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to a repository in Bitbucket > Repository settings > Default descriptions
 # Add a description that contains a code block in it, for example:

{code:java}
## Checklist
* [ ] test1
* [ ] test2
* [ ] test3
* [ ] test4
## Installation

```
echo hello
apt-get update && apt-get install cowsay
```
{code}
The description code block will be rendered like this when creating a PR:
 !Screen Shot 2020-06-26 at 16.04.04.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

The code block in the PR description is rendered correctly
h3. Actual Results

The PR description code block is rendered like the image below:
 !Screen Shot 2020-06-26 at 16.04.04.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

The workaround for this is to use single quote code blocks, like this:
{code:java}
## Checklist
* [ ] test1
* [ ] test2
* [ ] test3
* [ ] test4
## Installation

`
echo hello
apt-get update && apt-get install cowsay
`
{code}
This renders correctly.
fields.summary: Code blocks in default PR descriptions don't always work

fields.description:
*Summary:*

*Workaround:*
 There is no workaround currently
fields.summary: The Bitbucket annotations generated using Reports API don't show within the file

fields.description: Currently only exists on User Groups. The users on plan page has the list of users but no way to add a user.
fields.summary: Add member button should also exist on users on plan page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you have merged an identical branch to the master (or main branch), open pull requests of the descendant branch will be automatically merged.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new repository
# Push some files to the master branch
# Create the *dev* branch from the Bitbucket Cloud UI
# Pull the *dev* branch locally
# Push some files to the *dev* branch
# Create a PR for *dev* to *master* - https://bitbucket.org/srstaging/test_remote_branch_merge_local/pull-requests/1
# Create the new branch *dev_copy* on BB Cloud UI identical to the dev branch
# Pull the *dev_copy* branch locally
# Merge *dev_copy* to the master branch
# Commit a file into *master*
# Lastly, I push to the master branch

h3. Expected Results
The descendant branch open pull requests will not be automatically merged to the master (or main) branch.

h3. Actual Results
The descendant branch open pull requests are automatically merged to the master (or main) branch.

h3. Workaround
Configure branch permission to the descendant branch. - https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/use-branch-permissions/
fields.summary: Merging an identical branch will automatically merge open pull requests of the descendant branch

fields.description:
Currently, if you're trying to login to Bitbucket.org and there's a browser add-on/extension that is interfering with the login process, you will only get the page error below.
 !sign_in_page_error.png|thumbnail! 

It will be useful to have an error message that describes the actual nature of the error.
This way, users will be able to have a hint on what to do/troubleshoot next.
fields.summary: Useful error message when there's something is wrong while logging in
